intro: Cyrtandra dinocalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are usually oval or lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Cyrtandra dinocalyx plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
